newsitem.title: MEXICO: Tribasa subsidiary sells bond subscription.
newsitem.headline: Tribasa subsidiary sells bond subscription.

text.p: Concesionaria Tribasa Inela, SA, a Chilean subsidiary of Mexican construction company, Grupo Tribasa, said on Friday it will issue bonds in the Chilean capital markets to pay a loan of 3.055 million UFs.
The 25-year bonds, for a total of 3.15 million UFs, or about $98.5 million, will be issued before the end of 1998.
The annual interest rate is 7.5 percent.
All payments of principal and interest will be made in Chilean pesos at the equivalent rate of the Unidad de Fomention (UF), an inflation indexed rate.
The issue is being arranged by AIG Investment Corp (Latinamerica) SA.
The loan was provided by a syndicate of commercial banks for the construction of the toll road "Acceso Norte a Concepcion."
On February 20, local investors undersigned total offered rights repesenting 50 percent of the issue that will take place after at least six months of operation, the company said.
The bonds are securitized by cash flows generated by minimum toll revenues guaranteed by the government.
